content.header: You are warmly welcomed to this Digital Didactic Resource (DDR) for the Computer Networks Learning Unit (LU) offered at the School of Computing of the National Polytechnic Institute. This DDR was developed with the purpose of promoting autonomous learning, as well as facilitating, enriching, and strengthening the teaching-learning processes of the LU in question in the traditional (in-person) modality. The learning unit contributes to the graduate profile of Computer Systems Engineering by developing skills in analyzing the functions of the Open Systems Interconnection reference model and the TCP/IP protocol stack, designing logical and physical topologies of a local area network according to EIA/TIA/ANSI standards, and configuring routing algorithms. Additionally, it fosters teamwork, leadership, and decision-making.
content.main-text: The learning unit contributes to the graduate profile of Computer Systems Engineering by developing skills in analyzing the functions of the Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) reference model and the TCP/IP protocol stack, as well as designing logical and physical topologies for local area networks (LAN) in accordance with EIA/TIA/ANSI standards. Additionally, it covers the configuration of routing algorithms. Furthermore, it promotes teamwork, leadership, and decision-making skills.

content.header: The students will engage in the following activities:

list.i1: Documentary research on the topics to be covered in each class
list.i2: Guided discussion of concepts for programming the protocol analyzer.
list.i4: Use of a sniffer to manipulate packages containing the protocols.
list.i5: Use of a network simulator/emulator for network design
list.i6: Development of a phased project throughout the four thematic units, including a protocol analyzer and network scenario configuration.

content.header: Design the logical and physical topologies of a local area network based on its fundamentals, data transmission techniques, and network, internet, and transport layers.

list.i2: Documented and correctly executed software programs.
list.i5: Configuration of scenarios in network simulators/emulators.
list.i6: Phase 1 of the project: configuration of the network card driver in promiscuous mode for frame capture
list.i7: Phase 2 of the project: analysis of network access layer protocols
list.i8: Phase 3 of the project: analysis of internetworking layer protocols
list.i9: Phase 4 of the project: analysis of transport layer protocols
list.i10: Phase 5 of the project: additional functions: frame filtering, frame import and export.
list.i11: Phase 6 of the project: configuration of a network scenario in a simulator/emulator.
